Andy Coulson , who became Tony Blair David Cameron 's director of communications after last year's election, unexpectedly quit overnight conceding that his involvement in the affair made it difficult to give 110 per cent to his job. His departure sent shockwaves around Westminister and came just hours after the sudden resignation of one of Labour's most senior MPs, shadow chancellor Alan Johnson, who stepped down on Thursday night
